explanations.machine learning: The paper discusses the use of deep learning models for fund analysis, which is a subset of machine learning.
explanations.deep learning: The paper explicitly mentions the use of deep learning in the title and abstract, specifically for fund intelligent trading systems.
explanations.neural network: The paper employs RNN and LSTM models, which are types of neural networks.
explanations.long short-term memory: The paper uses LSTM models to analyze fund data and discover implicit dependencies in time series data.
explanations.LSTM: The paper mentions LSTM as a key component in the encoder-decoder architecture for analyzing fund data.
explanations.sequence-to-sequence learning: The paper uses an encoder-decoder architecture, which is commonly associated with sequence-to-sequence learning.
explanations.seq2seq: The encoder-decoder architecture mentioned in the paper is a form of seq2seq learning.
explanations.encoder-decoder: The paper describes the use of an encoder-decoder architecture in the Improved RNN model.
explanations.attention mechanism: The paper applies an attention mechanism to the encoder and decoder to improve the analysis of fund data.
explanations.support vector machine: The paper mentions SVM as one of the traditional methods used in previous research for intelligent investment systems.
explanations.SVM: The paper refers to SVM as a method used in prior work for building intelligent investment systems.
explanations.feature learning: The paper discusses the analysis of fund features, which involves learning relevant features from the data.
explanations.feature representation: The encoder in the proposed model is responsible for analyzing fund features, implying feature representation.
explanations.representation learning: The use of deep learning models like LSTM and attention mechanisms involves learning representations of the data.
